intro: Lotononis venosa, commonly known as the velvetleaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white petals. The plant typically grows in open grasslands and has a sprawling growth habit with hairy stems and leaves. Its botanical features include lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered inflorescences that bloom in spring. It is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and hardy nature.
